clinical_study.brief_title: Immunological Memory Induced by the 13valent Pneumococcal Conjugate(PCV13) and 23valent Plain Polysaccharide Vaccine(PPV23) in HIV-infected Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Immunogenicity and Immunological Memory Induced by the 13valent Pneumococcal Conjugate(PCV13) and 23valent Plain Polysaccharide Vaccine(PPV23) in HIV-infected Adults

lead_sponsor.agency: Aghia Sophia Children's Hospital of Athens

clinical_study.source: Aghia Sophia Children's Hospital of Athens

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of a combined vaccination schedule of the 13-valent pneumococcal conjugate (PCV13) and 23valent plain polysaccharide vaccine (PPV23) on the establishment of immunological memory in HIV-infected adults on ART.

primary_outcome.measure: immunoglobulin G (IgG) B memory cell response one month post vaccination (measured by flow cytometry)
primary_outcome.description: immunoglobulin G (IgG) B memory cell response one month post vaccination (measured by flow cytometry)

primary_outcome.measure: immunoglobulin M (IgM) B memory cell response one month post vaccination (measured by flow cytometry)
primary_outcome.description: immunoglobulin M (IgM) B memory cell response one month post vaccination (measured by flow cytometry)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- CD4 T cell count >200cells/Î¼l

Exclusion Criteria:
- no previously recorded allergy to PCV, PPV23
- no intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) given within the previous 6 months
- no other vaccine given within the previous 6 months
